publicationstmt.publisher: University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-06-09 13:21:16 -0400.

change.item: Four boxes and 149 digital files added.

repository.corpname: University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center

did.abstract: The Reel World String Band records (dated circa 1971-2016, undated; 8.14 cubic feet; 19 boxes, 2 oversize boxes; 44 GB, 884 digital files) primarily comprise promotional fliers, concert posters, contracts, programs, and articles that document the Kentucky women's band and its commitment to social justice advocacy from the band's founding in 1977 to the present.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection contains materials redacted due to privacy concerns, such as social security numbers or personal health information. Access to the originals documents is restricted.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged into 6 series by subject and format: Band information, Records, Photographs, Posters, Artifacts, and Audiovisual materials.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Formed in Kentucky in 1977 after a musical celebration at the International Women's Year Conference in Lexington, the Reel World String Band's original lineup featured Sue Massek on banjo and guitar, Karen Jones on fiddle, Sharon Ruble on bass, Belle Jackson on guitar, and Bev Futrell on mandolin, guitar, and harmonica.

The band's repertoire consists of a combination of traditional Appalachian songs and original songs that incorporate old-time music with influences from blues, jazz, and country. They draw inspiration from other musicians, including Florence Reece, Sara Ogan Gunning, and Lily May Ledford. With a dual focus on the preservation of Appalachian traditions and on advocacy for social justice causes, the Reel World String Band has a history of playing diverse venues. In addition to performing on concert stages and at folk festivals, the band has performed at conferences in support of activist endeavors to improve rights for women and the working class as well as at rallies and picket lines in protest of coal mining practices. The band has also led workshops on a variety of topics, including banjo and fiddle styles, the history of women in traditional music, songs of labor and environmental struggle, and old-time Appalachian dancing, traditional instruments, and musical techniques.

Current Reel World String Band members include original members Sue Massek, Bev Futrell, Karen Jones, and Sharon Ruble, who rejoined the band in 1995. Pianist Elise Melrood, who performed intermittently with the band and contributed to multiple Reel World albums, joined the band officially in 1995.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: 2016ms014 : [identification of item], Reel World String Band records, 1971-2016, undated, University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In keeping with the band's original organization, materials in the Records series are dated according to the date of the performance and not necessarily to the date of the materials. Date discrepancies are detailed in scope and content notes for relevant files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Reel World String Band records (dated circa 1971-2016, undated; 8.14 cubic feet; 19 boxes, 2 oversize boxes; 44 GB, 884 digital files) primarily comprise promotional fliers, concert posters, contracts, programs, photographs, and articles that document the Kentucky women's band and its commitment to social justice advocacy from the band's founding in 1977 to the present. The Reel World String Band's activist efforts throughout Kentucky and Appalachia are reflected in programs and performance contracts for fundraisers on behalf of organizations such as the Cincinnati Urban Appalachia League and The Women's National Coal Miners Conference. Articles and correspondence describe additional benefit performances held by the band for striking workers at the Pittston Coal Company mines and at the Harlan County Jericol mines. Concert posters and fliers detail the Reel World String Band's history of performing in coffee houses, on college campuses, and at women's, Appalachian, and folk festivals.

The collection also includes performance photographs, festival artifacts, LPs and CDs of Reel World String Band's albums, video recordings of the band's concerts, and a 2008 documentary film of performance clips and interviews with the band.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comprises promotional biographies and articles about members of the Reel World String Band, a comprehensive list of the band's performances, correspondence with the band's agent from Real People's Music, and manuscript song lyrics, lists, and notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between the Reel World String Band and the band's agent Josh Dunson of Real People's Music.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Draft designs for Reel World String Band albums Live Music and The Coast is Clear.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes list of 1995-1996 solo performances, school concerts, and artist residencies by Sue Massek.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Constitutes the bulk of the collection, with records of the Reel World String Band from its founding to the present. Comprises articles on the band, reviews of the band's performances, correspondence with fans and venue managers, and performance contracts, fliers, schedules, and programs.
Arranged chronologically by year, and thereunder alphabetically by format and subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence with the band's first agent, Jason Pate. Also includes a business card for the Reel World String Band.

did.unittitle: Grace House Learning/Training Center performance directions
Jericol Mines coal miners strike performances

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reel World String Band sang on the February 12, 1979 Jericol Mines picket line in Harlan County, Kentucky and played at a benefit for striking miners on April 1, 1979 and at a rally on June 26, 1979.

Includes lyrics of songs written for Reel World String Band by Mary Lou (Layne) Chandler, including Battle of Jericol, Jericol Women, and Thread of Justice. Includes handwritten documentation of the Jericol mine strike by Mary Lou and a description of Mary Lou by Karen Jones.

did.unittitle: Olive Hill Factory workers benefit concerts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reel World String Band played for a benefit for the Olive Hill Factory Workers on July 4, 1979 at Carter Caves State Park, Kentucky and on August 4, 1979 in Ashland, Kentucky. Songwriter Mary Lou (Layne) Chandler wrote Thread of Justice and Evergreen as tributes to these striking women workers. Both songs are on Reel World's first album.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Karen Jones, Sue Massek, Bev Futrell, and Bev's daughter Stacy Futrell performed in the festival, which took place from October 2-16, 1989. Includes contract, itinerary, publicity, lyrics of songs sung on tour, Italian translation of Belle Ciao, set lists, contacts, and postcards mailed to Sharon Ruble, who was unable to attend. Reel World String Band stayed an additional week to tour Florence and Rome.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comprises performance posters and oversize promotional fliers for Reel World String Band concerts and festivals in which the band performed. Arranged chronologically by year of performance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comprises festival and performance admission bracelets, buttons, badges, passes, patches, and stickers. Also includes performance buttons and badges for performers Bev Futrell and Karen Jones.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comprises audiocassettes of folk music songs, grooved and optical audio discs of Reel World String Band albums, videocassettes and digital files of Reel World String Band performances, and a 2008 documentary film on the Reel World String Band that features interviews with band members Sue Massek, Bev Futrell, Karen Jones, Sharon Ruble, and Elise Melrood.

The discography of Reel World String Band albums includes eight recordings: The Reel World String Band (1981), Long Way to Harlan (1982), In Good Time (1984), Appalachian Wind (1989), whatnots (1996), The Coast is Clear (2001), Mountain Song: Reflections (2002), and Live Music (2005). Mountain Song: Reflections is a remastered compilation of songs from the band's first three recordings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: All audiocassettes were sent to Karen Jones and Bev Futrell by Margaret (Peggy) Daole from Cleveland, Ohio except the Pittston radio reunion tapes. Arranged alphabetically by cassette title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: All grooved audio discs are 33 1/3 rpm 12-inch long playing vinyl records. Reel World String Band albums are organized chronologically, with the 1984 compilation album They'll Never Keep Us Down: Women's Coal Mining Songs at the end of the subseries.

unittitle.title: They'll Never Keep Us Down: Women's Coal Mining Songs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This compilation album features three songs by the Reel World String Band: Draglines, The Battle of Jericol, and What She Aims to Be.
